scenes.name: Cyclone Approaches
scenes.summary: A cyclone approaches, causing chaos as Dorothy and Toto struggle to get to safety.

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Auntie Em! Auntie Em!

characters.name: Aunt Em
characters.quote: Henry! Henry! I can't find Dorothy!

scenes.name: Munchkinland Arrival
scenes.summary: Dorothy's house lands in Munchkinland, killing the Wicked Witch of the East.
scenes.firstLine: Toto -- I've a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore.
scenes.lastLine: We must be over the rainbow!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: We must be over the rainbow!

scenes.name: Meeting the Scarecrow
scenes.summary: Dorothy meets the Scarecrow and they decide to travel to Emerald City together.
scenes.firstLine: Well, we haven't really met properly, have we?

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Well, we haven't really met properly, have we?

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: Do you think if I went with you this Wizard would give me some brains?

scenes.name: Rescue from the Poles
scenes.summary: Dorothy helps the Scarecrow down from his pole.
scenes.firstLine: Oh, well, here -- let me help you.

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh, dear -- that must be terribly uncomfortable.

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: Oh, that's very kind of you -- very kind.

scenes.name: Apple Orchid Conflict
scenes.summary: Dorothy and Scarecrow encounter aggressive trees in the apple orchard.

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: We've been walking a long ways and I was hungry and -- Did you say...

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: Come along, Dorothy -- you don't want any of those apples.

scenes.name: Encounter with the Tin Man
scenes.summary: Dorothy and Scarecrow discover and assist the rusted Tin Man.
scenes.firstLine: Why, it's a man! A man made out of tin!
scenes.lastLine: Oil can? Oh -- oh, here it is!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Where do you want to be oiled first?

characters.name: Tin Man
characters.quote: My mouth -- my mouth!

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: He said his mouth.

scenes.name: The Haunted Forest
scenes.summary: The group ventures into the Haunted Forest where they confront various frightening obstacles.
scenes.firstLine: I'd turn back if I were you.

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh -- Oh, Tin Man! Oh!

characters.name: Tin Man
characters.quote: From now on, we're on enemy ground.

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: You know something? I believe there're spooks around here.

characters.name: Lion
characters.quote: I'd turn back if I were you.

scenes.name: Witch's Attack
scenes.summary: The Witch attacks the group with a spell in the forest, exacerbating their fear and disorientation.
scenes.lastLine: I do believe in spooks! I do -- I do -- I do -- I do -- I do -- I do!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh! Oh, Tin Man! Oh!

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: I believe they're spooks around here.

characters.name: Lion
characters.quote: I do believe in spooks, I do believe in spooks.

characters.name: Tin Man
characters.quote: That's ridiculous! Spooks -- that's silly.

scenes.name: Escape from the Witch's Castle
scenes.summary: The group narrowly escapes from the Witch's castle following a series of traps and attacks by the Winkie Guards.
scenes.firstLine: That's right. Don't hurt them right away. We'll let them think about it a little, first!
scenes.lastLine: They've gotten away! Stop them! Stop them!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh!

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: It's no use trying the doors again! Which room is it?

characters.name: Lion
characters.quote: Trapped! Trapped like mice -- er -- rats!

characters.name: Tin Man
characters.quote: Go ahead - do something! Roar! Roar!

scenes.name: Witch's Final Threat
scenes.summary: The Wicked Witch of the West threatens Dorothy, revealing her plan to kill her once the hourglass runs out.
scenes.firstLine: Do you see that? That's how much longer you've got to be alive!
scenes.lastLine: I can't wait forever to get those shoes!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh, please give me back my dog!

characters.name: Wicked Witch
characters.quote: That's a good little girl. I knew you'd see reason.

scenes.name: Dorothy's Dilemma
scenes.summary: Dorothy remains trapped and terrified as the hourglass runs out, with the Witch taunting her about her impending doom.
scenes.firstLine: Do you see that? That's how much longer you've got to be alive!
scenes.lastLine: I can't wait forever to get those shoes!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: I'm frightened, Auntie Em -- I'm frightened!

characters.name: Wicked Witch
characters.quote: That's how much longer you've got to be alive!

scenes.name: The Rescue
scenes.summary: The Scarecrow, Tin Man, and Lion devise a plan to rescue Dorothy, bravely confronting the Winkie Guards.
scenes.lastLine: I've got a plan how to get in there.

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: I've got a plan how to get in there.

characters.name: Tin Man
characters.quote: You put up a great fight, Lion.

characters.name: Lion
characters.quote: Yeah. Me?

scenes.name: Melting the Witch
scenes.summary: Dorothy inadvertently melts the Wicked Witch while trying to save the Scarecrow from being set on fire.
scenes.firstLine: You cursed brat! Look what you've done!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh, you cursed brat! Look what you've done! I'm melting! Melting!

characters.name: Wicked Witch
characters.quote: What a world! What a world!

scenes.name: Return to the Wizard
scenes.summary: The group returns to the Wizard with the Witch's broomstick to claim their rewards.
scenes.firstLine: We've brought you the broomstick of the Wicked Witch of the West.
scenes.lastLine: So we'd like you to keep your promise to us, if you please, sir.

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: So we'd like you to keep your promise to us, if you please, sir.

characters.name: Wizard
characters.quote: Not so fast! Not so fast! I'll have to give the matter a little thought!

scenes.name: Wizard's True Identity
scenes.summary: The Wizard's true identity as a regular man from Omaha, Nebraska, is revealed when Toto pulls back a curtain.
scenes.firstLine: Pay no attention to that man behind the curtain!
scenes.lastLine: I'm a very good man. I'm just a very bad Wizard.

characters.name: Wizard
characters.quote: I'm a very good man. I'm just a very bad Wizard.

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh, you're a very bad man!

scenes.name: The Wizard's Departure
scenes.summary: The Wizard attempts to take Dorothy back to Kansas in his balloon, but leaves without her as she chases after Toto.
scenes.firstLine: And in that balloon, my dear Dorothy, you and I will return to the land of E Pluribus Unum!
scenes.lastLine: I can't come back! I don't know how it works! Goodbye, folks!

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh, come back! Don't go without me! Please come back!

characters.name: Wizard
characters.quote: I can't come back! I don't know how it works!

scenes.name: Glinda's Revelation
scenes.summary: Glinda arrives and reveals to Dorothy that she has had the power to return home all along by using the magic of the ruby slippers.
scenes.firstLine: You don't need to be helped any longer. You've always had the power to go back to Kansas.
scenes.lastLine: Then close your eyes and tap your heels together three times. And think to yourself, 'There's no place like home.'

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Well, I -- I think that it -- that it wasn't enough just to want to see Uncle Henry and Auntie Em -- and it's that -- if I ever go looking for my heart's desire again, I won't look any further than my own backyard.

characters.name: Glinda
characters.quote: You don't need to be helped any longer. You've always had the power to go back to Kansas.

scenes.name: Dorothy's Farewell
scenes.summary: Dorothy prepares to leave Oz, saying goodbye to her friends with emotional farewells.
scenes.lastLine: Goodbye, Tin Man. Oh, don't cry. You'll rust so dreadfully. Here's your oil can. Goodbye.

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Goodbye, Tin Man. Oh, don't cry. You'll rust so dreadfully. Here's your oil can. Goodbye.

characters.name: Tin Man
characters.quote: Now I know I've got a heart -- 'cause it's breaking.

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.quote: I think I'll miss you most of all.

characters.name: Lion
characters.quote: I would never've found it if it hadn't been for you.

scenes.name: Return to Kansas
scenes.summary: Using the power of the ruby slippers, Dorothy returns to her Kansas home, finding herself back in her bedroom surrounded by her loved ones.
scenes.firstLine: There's no place like home. There's no place like home.
scenes.lastLine: -- there's no place like home -- there's no place like home --

characters.name: Dorothy
characters.quote: Oh, Auntie Em -- it's you!

characters.name: Aunt Em
characters.quote: Yes, darling.

locations.name: Emerald City
locations.quote: It's beautiful, isn't it? Just like I knew it would be. He really must be a wonderful Wizard to live in a City like that!

locations.name: Munchkinland
locations.quote: Just follow the Yellow Brick Road.

locations.name: Poppy Field
locations.quote: Dorothy and Group in f.g. -- Yes -- let's run!

characters.quote: Toto -- I've a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore.
characters.explanation: A vibrant pink, reflecting Dorothy's youthful innocence and the magical journey she embarks upon.

characters.quote: Of course, I'm not bright about doing things, but if you'll just...
characters.explanation: A soft beige, reminiscent of the earth and straw, aligning with his humble, agricultural roots.

characters.quote: When a man's an empty kettle, He should be on his mettle. And yet I'm torn apart.
characters.explanation: A metallic silver, symbolizing his tin construction and the quest for his missing heart.

characters.quote: Oh! Look at that! Look at that! Oh -- Ohhhh -- I want to go home -- I want to go home!
characters.explanation: A deep ochre, capturing the Lion's majestic yet fearful nature, reflecting his journey towards courage.

characters.quote: Child -- you cut me to the quick! I'm an old Kansas man myself...born and...
characters.explanation: A moss green, representing his enigmatic and elusive nature, as well as his connection to the earthy reality of Kansas.

characters.quote: Catch him, you fool!
characters.explanation: A dark, menacing green, indicative of her villainous role and the iconic color of her wickedness.

characters.quote: Just follow the Yellow Brick Road.
characters.explanation: A light, soothing pink, evoking her gentle, guiding presence and magical benevolence.

characters.quote: Dorothy, Dorothy! Dear, dear! Where are you? It's coming, Henry. It's coming!
characters.explanation: A warm, earthy rose, reflecting her nurturing and caring nature, a grounding force for Dorothy.
